sen.j: 市辺押磐皇子（いちのへのおしはのみこ、? - 安康天皇3年（456年）10月 (旧暦)）は、記紀・『風土記』に伝えられる5世紀頃の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha [(市辺押磐皇子) Ichinobe no Oshiha no Miko; his birth date is unknown and his death date was in October of year'456'] appeared in the Kiki ["Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)] and Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century Japan.

Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha (Ichinobe no Oshiha no Miko; his birth date is unknown and his death date was in 456) appeared in the Kiki ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matte]) and "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) and Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century Japan.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha (Ichinobe no Oshiha no Miko; his birth date is unknown and his death date was in 456) appeared in the Kiki ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matte]) and "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) and Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 磐坂皇子（いわさかのみこ）・磐坂市辺押羽皇子・天万国万押磐尊（あめよろずくによろずおしはのみこと、以上『日本書紀』）・市辺之忍歯王・市辺忍歯別王（いちのへのおしはわけのみこ、以上『古事記』）・市辺天皇命（いちのへのすめらみこと、『播磨国風土記』）とも。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha (市辺押磐皇子) was also know as: 'Iwasaka no Miko (磐坂皇子),' 'Iwasaka no Ichinobe no Oshiha Oji (磐坂市辺押羽皇子),' and 'Ameyorozukuni Yorozuoshiha no Mikoto'(天万国万押磐尊) (all of above were written in Nihonshoki"); and 'Ichinohe no Oshiha O (市辺之忍歯王)' and 'Ichinohe no Oshihawake no Miko' (市辺忍歯別王) (all of above were written In the "Kojiki"); Ichinohe no Sumera Mikoto (市辺天皇命) was written in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province).

Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was also know as: Iwasaka no Miko, Iwasaka no Ichinobe no Oshiha Oji, and Ameyorozukuni Yorozuoshiha no Mikoto (all of above were written in Nihonshoki"); and Ichinohe no Oshiha O and Ichinohe no Oshihawake no Miko (all of above were written In the "Kojiki"); Ichinohe no Sumera Mikoto was written in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province).
sen.cmt: 、シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was also know as: Iwasaka no Miko, Iwasaka no Ichinobe no Oshiha Oji, and Ameyorozukuni Yorozuoshiha no Mikoto (all of above were written in "Nihonshoki"); and Ichinohe no Oshiha O and Ichinohe no Oshihawake no Miko (all of above were written In the "Kojiki"); Ichinohe no Sumera Mikoto was written in the "Harimanokuni Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of the Harima Province).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 履中天皇の第1皇子で、母は葛城葦田宿禰（あしたのすくね）の女・黒媛である。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was the first Imperial Prince of the Emperor Richu; the mother of Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was Kurohime (黒媛), a daughter of 'Ashita no Kusune (葛城葦田宿禰).'
Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was the first Imperial Prince of the Emperor Richu; the mother of Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was Kurohime, a daughter of Ashita no Kusune.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was the first Imperial Prince of the Emperor Richu; the mother of Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was Kurohime, a daughter of Ashita no Kusune.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、顕宗天皇・仁賢天皇（・飯豊青皇女）の父。
sen.e: Additionally 'Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha' was the father of the Emperor Kenzo (顕宗天皇), Emperor Ninken (仁賢天皇), and 'Iitoyo no Himemiko (飯豊青皇女).'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was the father of the Emperor Kenzo, Emperor Ninken, and Iitoyo no Himemiko.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Additionally Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was the father of the Emperor Kenzo, Emperor Ninken, and Iitoyo no Himemiko.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安康天皇・雄略天皇の従兄弟に当たる。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha' was a cousin of the Emperor Anko (安康天皇) and the Emperor Yuryaku (雄略天皇).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was a cousin of the Emperor Anko and the Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was a cousin of the Emperor Anko and the Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 押歯（八重歯）であったことから、この名があるという。
sen.e: The origin of name for 'Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha' was "Oshiha" which meant double tooth; evidentially, he apparently had double the number of teeth.
The origin of name for Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was "Oshiha" which meant double tooth.
sen.cmt: evidentially, he apparently had double the number of teeth.の部分は該当部分が無いようなので削除し、シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: The origin of name for Prince Ichinobe no Oshiha was Oshiha which meant double tooth.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 安康天皇3年（456年）8月、安康天皇が眉輪王によって暗殺されたが、天皇は生前、押磐皇子に王位を継承させよううとしていた。
sen.e: On August of '456,' the Emperor Anko was assassinated by Prince Mayowa, but he had chosen Prince Oshiha as his successor and would pass on the Imperial Throne to Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 456, the Emperor Anko was assassinated by Prince Mayowa, but he had chosen Prince Oshiha as his successor and would pass on the Imperial Throne to Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 旧暦の月の削除しました。
sen.e: In September 456, the Emperor Anko was assassinated by Prince Mayowa, but he had chosen Prince Oshiha as his successor and would pass on the Imperial Throne to Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 新暦の月を追加

sen.j: そのように、後事を託そうとしていた。
sen.e: Thus, He was going to ask Prince Oshiha to look after his future affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, He was going to ask Prince Oshiha to look after his future affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Thus, He was going to ask Prince Oshiha to look after his future affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: かねてからこのことを恨んでいた大泊瀬皇子（後の雄略）は、10月に押磐皇子を近江国の蚊屋野（かやの、現在の滋賀県蒲生郡日野町 (滋賀県)鎌掛付近か）へ狩猟に誘い出した。
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse (later, the Emperor Yuryaku) while bearing malice toward Prince Oshiha and then using the pretense of a hunt, invited him to Kayano, Omi Province (the current possible location is around area of Kaigake, Hino Town, Gamo County, Shiga Prefecture) in October of '456.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse (later, the Emperor Yuryaku) while bearing malice toward Prince Oshiha and then using the pretense of a hunt, invited him to Kayano, Omi Province (the current possible location is around the area of Kaigake, Hino Town, Gamo County, Shiga Prefecture) in October.
sen.cmt: of ‘456.’年の記載が無いので削除し、area→ the areaに変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse (later, the Emperor Yuryaku) while bearing malice toward Prince Oshiha and then using the pretense of a hunt, invited him to Kayano, Omi Province (the current possible location is around the area of Kaigake, Hino Town, Gamo County, Shiga Prefecture) in November.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: そこで、「イノシシがいる」と偽って皇子を射殺した。
sen.e: There, Prince Ohatsuse tricked Prince Oshiha, by saying; "There are wild boars," and shot him with arrows, causing the death of Prince Oshida.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There, Prince Ohatsuse tricked Prince Oshiha, by saying; "There are wild boars," and killed him with an arrow.
sen.cmt: 後半部分書き直しました。
sen.e: There, Prince Ohatsuse tricked Prince Oshiha, by saying; 'There are wild boars,' and killed him with an arrow.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: さらに、遺骸を抱いて嘆き悲しんだ帳内（とねり）の佐伯部売輪（さえきべのうるわ、仲子とも）をも殺した。
sen.e: Further more, Prince Ohatsuse would kill 'Sakibe no Uruwa' [(佐伯部売); also known as Nakachiko (仲子)], a Toneri (a lower class officer whose duty was guarding and taking care of members of Imperial Princes and Princes of Imperial family and royal family.); this was done while 'Sakibe no Uruwa' was in his grief and saddened as he held the dead body of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, Prince Ohatsuse killed Sakibe no Uruwa (also known as Nakachiko), a Toneri (a lower class officer whose duty was guarding and taking care of members of Imperial Princes and Princes of Imperial family and royal family.); this was done while Sakibe no Uruwa was in his grief and saddened as he held the dead body of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: Furthermoreの誤字訂正と、()と[]の変更、シングルクオートを削除をしました
sen.e: Furthermore, Prince Ohatsuse killed Sakibe no Uruwa (also known as Nakachiko), a Toneri (a lower class officer whose duty was guarding and taking care of members of Imperial Princes and Princes of Imperial family and royal family.); this was done while Sakibe no Uruwa was in his grief and saddened as he held the dead body of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、皇子とともに同じ穴に埋めた（つまり、塚が築かれなかった）という。
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse buried Prince Oshiha and 'Sakibe no Uruwa' together in the same hall (in other words, no one built a mound for Prince Oshiha.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse buried Prince Oshiha and Sakibe no Uruwa together in the same hall (in other words, no one built a mound for Prince Oshiha.)
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Ohatsuse buried Prince Oshiha and Sakibe no Uruwa together in the same hall (in other words, no one built a mound for Prince Oshiha.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子の億計・弘計（後の仁賢・顕宗）兄弟は難が及ぶのを恐れ、帳内とともに丹波国を経て播磨国明石郡に逃れた。
sen.e: The children of Prince Oshiha, brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) (later, the Emperor Ninken and the Emperor Kenzo), were afraid of an approaching danger; so, they escaped with their Toneri officers to Akashi County in Harima Province via Tamba Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The children of Prince Oshiha, brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) (later, the Emperor Ninken and the Emperor Kenzo), were afraid of an approaching danger; so, they escaped with their Toneri officers to Akashi County in Harima Province via Tamba Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The children of Prince Oshiha, brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) (later, the Emperor Ninken and the Emperor Kenzo), were afraid of an approaching danger; so, they escaped with their Toneri officers to Akashi County in Harima Province via Tamba Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そこで、名を隠して縮見屯倉首（しじみのみやけのおびと）に仕えた。
sen.e: There, the brothers served Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (縮見屯倉首) but concealed their names.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There, the brothers served Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (縮見屯倉首) but concealed their names.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: There, the brothers served Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (縮見屯倉首) but concealed their names.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 清寧天皇3年（482年）億計 ・弘計は宮中に迎えられ、顕宗天皇元年（485年）に弟の弘計王が即位。
sen.e: In '482,' the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) were welcomed into the imperial court; later, the youngest brother, Prince Oke (弘計王) ascended to the throne (the Emperor Kenzo) in '485.'
In 482, the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) were welcomed into the imperial court; later, the youngest brother, Prince Oke ascended to the throne (the Emperor Kenzo) in 485'
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: In 482, the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計) were welcomed into the imperial court; later, the youngest brother, Prince Oke ascended to the throne (the Emperor Kenzo) in 485'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 弘計は置目老嫗（おきめのおみな）の案内から亡父の遺骨の所在を知り得て、改めて陵を築いた。
sen.e: Prince Oke (弘計) located the resting place of the remains of his late father, through the varied guidance of 'Okime no Omina' (置目老嫗), and he would build a new mound for his father.
Prince Oke located the resting place of the remains of his late father, through the varied guidance of Okime no Omina, and he built a new mound for his father.
sen.cmt: would build→builtにし、variedを削除、シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Oke located the resting place of the remains of his late father, through the varied guidance of Okime no Omina, and he built a new mound for his father.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この時、皇子と仲子の遺骨が頭蓋骨を除いて区別出来なかった。
sen.e: During the recovering the remains, the workers who assigned by Prince Oke failed to identify the separate remains of Prince Oshiha and Nakachiko, except for each skull.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the recovering the remains, the workers who assigned by Prince Oke failed to identify the separate remains of Prince Oshiha and Nakachiko, except for each skull.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: During the recovering the remains, the workers who assigned by Prince Oke failed to identify the separate remains of Prince Oshiha and Nakachiko, except for each skull.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、相似せた2つの陵を造ったとされる。
sen.e: Then, Prince Oke, seemed to order to the construction of two identical mounds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Prince Oke, seemed to order to the construction of two identical mounds.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Then, Prince Oke, seemed to order to the construction of two identical mounds.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現在、滋賀県東近江市市辺町に存する円墳2基（古保志塚という）がある。
sen.e: Currently, there are two enpun [circle (round) type Kofun (tumulus); as this refers to "Koboshitsuka"] tumulus in existence at Ichinobe-Cho, Higashiomi City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Currently, there are two round barrows (referred to "Koboshitsuka") in Ichinobe-Cho, Higashiomi City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 円墳は定訳でa round barrowと出ていたので、それを使用しました。
sen.e: Currently, there are two round barrows (referred to "Koboshitsuka") in Ichinobe-Cho, Higashiomi City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: それらは、それと伝えられ、宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: Historians and other experts believe that these tumuli are Prince Oshiha's burial mounds, and currently the Imperial Household Agency manages them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These tumuli are believed to be Prince Oshiha's burial mounds, and currently the Imperial Household Agency manages them.
sen.cmt: 受動態で訳しました。
sen.e: These tumuli are believed to be Prince Oshiha's burial mounds, and currently the Imperial Household Agency manages them.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィ ’→ '

sen.j: が、かつては同市木村町のケンサイ塚古墳（円墳・消滅）や妙法寺町の熊の森古墳（前方後円墳）を皇子墓に比定する異説もあった。
sen.e: In the past, there were differing theories through which historians and other experts could identify the Kensaitsuka Kofun (The Kofun was an enpun tumulus and disappeared) in Kimura-Cho, Higashiomi City and 'Kumon no Mori Kofun' (keyhole-shaped tumulus) inside Myoho-ji Temple as the burial mound of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the past, there were differing theories through which historians and other experts could identify the Kensaitsuka Kofun (The Kofun was an enpun tumulus and disappeared) in Kimura-Cho, Higashiomi City and 'Kumon no Mori Kofun' (keyhole-shaped tumulus) inside Myoho-ji Temple as the burial mound of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In the past, there were differing theories through which historians and other experts could identify the Kensaitsuka Kofun (The Kofun was an enpun tumulus and disappeared) in Kimura-Cho, Higashiomi City and Kuma no Mori Kofun (keyhole-shaped tumulus) inside Myoho-ji Temple as the burial mound of Prince Oshiha.
sen.cmt: Kumon→Kumaクォーテーション削除

sen.j: 妃：荑媛（はえひめ、荑は草冠＋夷。)
sen.e: Prince: Haehime [(荑媛); the character of her name "Hae (荑)" was made with Kusakanmuri (草冠) plus "I (夷)".
Prince: Haehime (荑媛; the character of her name "Hae" [荑] was made with Kusakanmuri [草冠] plus "I" [夷]).
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: Prince: Haehime (荑媛; the character of her name "Hae" [荑] was made with Kusakanmuri [草冠] plus "I" [夷]).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: (葛城蟻臣の女）
sen.e: She was a daughter of 'Katsutagi no Ari no Omi (葛城蟻臣)']
(She was a daughter of Katsutagi no Ari no Omi.)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更とシングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: (She was a daughter of Katsutagi no Ari no Omi.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 居夏姫（いなつひめ）
sen.e: Princess Inatsu [居夏姫) Inatsu Hime]
Princess Inatsu [居夏姫) Inatsu Hime]
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Princess Inatsu [居夏姫) Inatsu Hime]
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 億計王（おけのみこ、島稚子・大石尊・仁賢天皇）
sen.e: Prince Oke [Oke no Miko (億計王); also known as 'Shima no Wakugo' (島稚子), 'Oshi no Mikoto' (大石尊), and the Emperor Ninken (仁賢天皇)]
Prince Oke (Oke no Miko also known as Shima no Wakugo, Oshi no Mikoto, and the Emperor Ninken)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更とシングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Oke (Oke no Miko also known as Shima no Wakugo, Oshi no Mikoto, and the Emperor Ninken)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 弘計王（おけのみこ、来目稚子・顕宗天皇）
sen.e: Prince Oke [Oke no Miko (弘計王); also known as 'Kume no Wakugo' (来目稚子), and the Emperor Kenzo (顕宗天皇)]
Prince Oke (Oke no Miko; also known as Kume no Wakugo, and the Emperor Kenzo)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更とシングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Oke (Oke no Miko; also known as Kume no Wakugo, and the Emperor Kenzo)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 飯豊青皇女（いいとよのひめみこ、忍海部女王）。
sen.e: Princess Iitoyo no Hime ['Iitoyo no Hime Miko' (飯豊青皇); also known as 'Iitoo no Hime Miko' (忍海部女王)]
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Princess Iitoyo no Hime (Iitoyo no Hime Miko; also known as Iitoo no Hime Miko.)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更とシングルクオートを削除、ピリオドの補足しました。
sen.e: Princess Iitoyo no Hime (Iitoyo no Hime Miko; also known as Iitoo no Hime Miko.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 億計・弘計の姉とする方が妥当か。
sen.e: It is suitable to consider her as an elder sister of the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Is it suitable to consider her as an elder sister of the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計)?
sen.cmt: 疑問形にしました。
sen.e: Is it suitable to consider her as an elder sister of the brother princes Oke (億計) and Oke (弘計)?
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: あるいは、叔母と姉の二人が類似した名前を称したとも考えられる。
sen.e: Perhaps, two female family members of the brother princes, an aunt and sister, may have had similar names.
Perhaps, two female family members of the brother princes, an aunt and sister, may have had similar names.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Perhaps, two female family members of the brother princes, an aunt and sister, may have had similar names.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 橘王（たちばなのみこ）
sen.e: Prince Tachibana [Tachibana no Miko (橘王)]
Prince Tachibana (Tachibana no Miko)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更をしました。
sen.e: Prince Tachibana (Tachibana no Miko)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
